department.dept_long_name: Department of Organismic and Evolutionary Biology

course.title: Introduction to Vertebrate Surgery
course.meeting_text: W., 1-3, and a weekly lab, W., 3-6
course.description: Teaches the basic principles of aseptic surgery with emphasis on practicality. Students learn basic "open" surgery as well as newer high-tech videoscopic minimally invasive technique, obtaining hands-on experience in scrubbing, gowning, and sterile technique while serving as anesthetist and surgeon.
course.prerequisites: Comparative anatomy, Life Sciences 2 (or OEB 102), or equivalent course.
course.notes: Intended for the student interested in the application of surgical technique in higher studies in biology and related disciplines.
